result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 01:56 PM OFF THE RECORD: Attorney Laura Breun in court on behalf of defendant.  Robin W. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State will be filing amended Complaint amending to a Misdemeanor.

01:53 PM Attorney Amy Johnson in court for Laura Breun for Defendant Candy L Polk. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Candy L Polk appeared by phone means. Atty Breun was not available to appear at todays hearing, defendant would like Atty Breun to be present. CT: time limits waived. Prelim set in front of Br. 1 on 2/24/2022.
Preliminary hearing on February 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 20 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with BC. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:17 AM Defendant appeared.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
